hanzi-su-wiki:
喝

Значения

Громко восклицать, угрожать

Мнемоника

Покрикивать 口 как на слишком назойливого нищего 曷 (просит 日, вымаливая 七 подаяние, почтительно согнувшись 勹).

Варианты

喝

to drink; variant of 嗬
пить; вариант 嗬

to shout

rtega_mnemonic:
喝喝RS
X		drink, shout, call out
  • hoars voice: mouth 口 of a beggar asking for a drink
 呼; 欧 叫

喝喝RSdrink, shout, call out
  • beggar 曷 shouting with his mouth 口: he's drunk
呼; 欧 叫
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 曷 indicates the sound; 口 (mouth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
吃喝 [ chī hē ]: to eat and drink; food and drink
大吃大喝 [ dà chī dà hē ]: to eat and drink as much as one likes; to make a pig of oneself
喝醉 [ hē zuì ]: to get drunk
喝西北风 [ hē xī běi fēng ]: lit. drink the northwest wind (idiom); cold and hungry
胡吃海喝 [ hú chī hǎi hē ]: to eat and drink gluttonously; to pig out
喝彩 [ hè cǎi ]: to acclaim; to cheer
喝令 [ hè lìng ]: to shout an order or command
棒喝 [ bàng hè ]: practice in which a novice monk is shouted at or hit with a stick with the purpose of bringing about instant awakening (Buddhism); to rebuke sternly
吆五喝六 [ yāo wǔ hè liù ]: lit. to shout out hoping for fives and sixes when gambling with dice; a hubbub of gambling
喝倒彩 [ hè dào cǎi ]: to boo or jeer (as a sign of displeasure at an actor)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
    • 曷 [ hé ] what, why, where, which, how
heisig_chinese_memo: If you have a siesta with your mouthopen, you will wake up with a hoarse voice and want to drink something.
heisig_constituent: hoarse, mouth, mexican bandit, muchacho, siesta, sun, day, aroma, bound up, spoon, sitting on the ground
heisig_story: When the muchacho on siesta looks up at you and opens his mouth to talk, his voice is so hoarse that you cannot understand him.
koohiiStory1: If you have a siesta with your mouthopen, you will wake up with a hoarse voice.
koohiiStory2: After taking a siesta, you find that your mouth is hoarse (after all you ARE thirsty remember).
WaniKani_Radicals: 口, 日, 勹, 匕
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you put your spoon in the sun while you're in prison, a mouth will appear to scold you. You can never see who the mouth belongs to, but considering you're in prison it's probably a guard. Either way, that person doesn't like what you're doing and they keep scolding you when you put your spoon out into the sun.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine trying to reflect some precious sunlight into your prison room with a spoon. Now imagine a mouth appearing in the way of the sunlight and it scolds you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: One day you finally get fed up. You need to know who the mouth of the person who's scolding you is. You stick your spoon out into the sun and the mouth appears, scolding you right on time. You reach out and grab them. But in your hand is a pile of cats (かつ).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: WHAT KIND OF WORLD IS THIS THAT YOU'RE IN A PRISON WHERE CATS SCOLD YOU?!
Ru_Radicals: 勹 (обёртка), 匕 (ложка), 口 (рот), 日 (день)
Ru_trainchinese:
hē: (глаг) пить
hè: (глаг) громко кричать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the sun (日) the fragrant (匂) mouth (口) goes hoarse
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you have a siesta with your mouthopen, you will wake up with a hoarse voice and want to drink something.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " mouth " and "曷", the original meaning is thirsty. Today it has been replaced by " thirsty ". "Shuowen": "Drink, 㵣 also. From the mouth, the sound." And the " thirst " in "Shuowen" is the word " exhaustion ." The semantic functions of the words " drink ", " thirsty " and " exhaust " have been redistributed in later generations. The meaning of thirst can be derived from the desire to drink water, and this can be derived from the hoarse voice. At this time, " drink " is pronounced like ye in Mandarin; the meaning of thirst can be derived from the " drink " of drinking water, at this time " drink " Read like he sound in Mandarin. (See Chen Yingjie)

" Drink " means hoarse voice. For example, "Selected Works of Sima Xiangru (Zixu Fu)": "Pushing on the golden drum, blowing the song. The singing of the people, the sound is flowing." Wang Chong's "Lun Heng‧ Qi Shou": "Er Shenghao" With the sound of crying, those who swell long and live well, and those who sizzle and get wet are Yao."

" Drink " can also be used to express the meaning of shouting and shouting. For example, "Book of Jin-Liu Yi Biography": "If you drink it sharply, you will become Lu Yan."

" Drinking " also means frightening and threatening. For example, "Zhao Ce Two": "Fear to drink the princes in order to secede the land"; Xin Qiji's "Nine Proposals" II: "Suspicious drink, look back and dare not enter ."

Modern Chinese " drink " is mainly used to swallow liquid beverages or liquid foods, such as "drink tea", "drink water" and so on.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " mouth ", "曷", the original meaning is thirst.
humanum_full_description:
從「口」，「曷」聲，本義為口渴，今天已被「渴」取代。《說文》：「喝，㵣也。从口，曷聲。」而《說文》中的「渴」訓「盡也」，今作「竭」。「喝」、「渴」、「竭」這幾個字的表義功能在後世發生了重新分配。由口渴義可引申出想喝水，由此又可引申出聲音沙啞，此時「喝」讀如官話ye音；由口渴義引申出喝水的「喝」，此時「喝」讀如官話he音。（參陳英杰）

　　「喝」表聲音沙啞用例如《文選‧司馬相如〈子虛賦〉》：「摐金鼓，吹鳴籟。榜人歌，聲流喝。」王充《論衡‧氣壽》：「兒生號啼之聲，鴻朗高暢者壽，嘶喝濕下者夭。」

　　「喝」亦可借用表示大聲呼喊、吆喝之義。如《晉書‧劉毅傳》：「厲聲喝之，即成盧焉」。

　　「喝」還表示嚇唬、威脅，如《戰國策‧趙策二》：「恐喝諸侯，以求割地」；辛棄疾〈九議〉之二：「恫疑虛喝，反顧其後而不敢進。」

　　現代漢語「喝」主要用作把液體飲料或流質食物咽下去，如「喝茶」、「喝水」等。

從「 口 」，「 曷 」聲，本義為口渴，今天已被「 渴 」取代。《說文》：「喝，㵣也。从口，曷聲。」而《說文》中的「 渴 」訓「盡也」，今作「 竭 」。「 喝 」、「 渴 」、「 竭 」這幾個字的表義功能在後世發生了重新分配。由口渴義可引申出想喝水，由此又可引申出聲音沙啞，此時「 喝 」讀如官話ye音；由口渴義引申出喝水的「 喝 」，此時「 喝 」讀如官話he音。（參陳英杰） 「 喝 」表聲音沙啞用例如《文選‧司馬相如〈子虛賦〉》：「摐金鼓，吹鳴籟。榜人歌，聲流喝。」王充《論衡‧氣壽》：「兒生號啼之聲，鴻朗高暢者壽，嘶喝濕下者夭。」 「 喝 」亦可借用表示大聲呼喊、吆喝之義。如《晉書‧劉毅傳》：「厲聲喝之，即成盧焉」。 「 喝 」還表示嚇唬、威脅，如《戰國策‧趙策二》：「恐喝諸侯，以求割地」；辛棄疾〈九議〉之二：「恫疑虛喝，反顧其後而不敢進。」 現代漢語「 喝 」主要用作把液體飲料或流質食物咽下去，如「喝茶」、「喝水」等。
From the sound of " mouth" and " 曷", the original meaning is thirsty. Today it has been replaced by " thirsty". "Shuowen": "Drink, 㵣 also. From the mouth, the sound." And the " thirst" in "Shuowen" is the word " exhaustion." The semantic functions of the words " drink", " thirsty" and " exhaust" have been redistributed in later generations. The meaning of thirst can be derived from the desire to drink water, and this can be derived from the hoarse voice. At this time, " drink" is pronounced like ye in Mandarin; the meaning of thirst can be derived from the " drink" of drinking water, at this time " drink" Read like he sound in Mandarin. (See Chen Yingjie) " Drink" means hoarse voice. For example, "Selected Works of Sima Xiangru (Zixu Fu)": "Pushing on the golden drum, blowing the song. The singing of the people, the sound is flowing." Wang Chong's "Lun Heng‧ Qi Shou": "Er Shenghao" With the sound of crying, those who swell long and live well, and those who sizzle and get wet are Yao." " Drink" can also be used to express the meaning of shouting and shouting. For example, "Book of Jin-Liu Yi Biography": "If you drink it sharply, you will become Lu Yan." " Drinking" also means frightening and threatening. For example, "Zhao Ce Two": "Fear to drink the princes in order to secede the land"; Xin Qiji's "Nine Proposals" II: "Suspicious drink, look back and dare not enter ." Modern Chinese " drink" is mainly used to swallow liquid beverages or liquid foods, such as "drink tea", "drink water" and so on.

Seal characters (1)

喝字的基本解释

喝
hē
把液体饮料或流质食物咽下去：喝水。喝酒。喝茶。喝粥。
特指喝酒：喝醉了。

喝
hè
大声喊叫：喝彩。喝问。

喝
yè
声音嘶哑、噎塞：“儿生，号啼之声鸿朗高畅者寿，嘶喝湿下者夭”。

喝字的汉语字典释义

[①]［hè］
［《廣韻》許葛切，入曷，曉。］
“猲2”的被通假字。
(1)恐吓威胁。
(2)大声喊叫。多用于使令、呼唤、制止等。
(3)指高声宣读、唱颂。参见“喝禮”。
(4)买卖时吆定商品的价钱。
(5)用为征税时吆定税额。
(6)感叹词。
(7)见“喝欠”。
[②]［yè］
［《廣韻》於犗切，去夬，影。］
声音悲咽、嘶哑。
[③]［hē］
(1)饮用。
(2)指吸进气体。参见“喝3風”。

喝字的英文翻译

◎ 喝
drink

喝字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　喝； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页199第11
【唐韻】於介切【集韻】乙芥切，?音噎。【說文】㵣也。【後漢·竇憲傳】憲隂喝不得對。【註】隂喝，猶噎塞也。隂，於禁反。喝，一介反。　又【後漢·張酺傳】被矢貫咽，聲音流喝。【註】喝，一介反。廣蒼曰：聲之幽也。【張正見·秋蟬喝柳詩】長楊流喝盡。　又【玉篇】嘶聲也。【王充·論衡】兒生，號啼之聲鴻朗高暢者壽，嘶喝濕下者夭。　又【廣韻】於犗切【集韻】【正韻】於邁切【韻會】幺邁切，?音餲。【廣韻】嘶聲。　又【集韻】饐聲。【司馬相如·子虛賦】榜人歌聲流喝。【註】徐廣曰：喝，烏邁反。又【集韻】丘蓋切【韻會】苦蓋切，?音磕。【集韻】與?同，聲也。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?許葛切，音暍。【廣韻】本作?，訶也。【戰國策】恫疑虛喝。【又】橫人日夜務以秦權恐喝諸侯，以求割地。【集韻】亦作?。　又【集韻】何葛切，音曷。呼也。　又一曰喉喝，怒聲。

drink

Swallow liquid beverages or liquid food: drink water. drink. Drink tea. Drink porridge.
Specifically refers to drinking: drunk.
drink

Shout loudly: cheers. Drink and ask.
drink

The voice is hoarse and choking: "If a child is born, the sound of crying will live long, and the person who sighs and gets wet is Yao".
drink
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［hè］
["Guangyun" Xu Geqie, Entering, Xiao. ]
The false word for "猲2" was passed.
(1) Threats of intimidation.
(2) Shout loudly. It is mostly used to make, call, stop, etc.
(3) Refers to aloud reading and singing. See "drinking ceremony".
(4) Set the price of goods when buying and selling.
(5) It is used to set the tax amount at the time of taxation.
(6) Interjection.
(7) See "Drink owed".
[②]［yè］
["Guangyun" Yu Qi cut, go to 夬, shadow. ]
The voice was sad and hoarse.
[③] [hē]
(1) Drinking.
(2) Refers to the inhalation of gas. See "Drink 3 Winds".
drink

喝
Пиктофонетические символы.
Рот выражает смысл, его образ подобен открытому рту, что означает открытие, чтобы кричать; (он) выражает, 曷 - провинциальный язык истощения, что означает, что пить - значит кричать.
Первоначальный смысл - кричать
Охе громко кричал: ~ Цай "Да ~" Громко. Эхе ① Вдыхайте жидкость или жидкость: одна вода, ~ вино "~ каша. 2 особенно относится к выпивке: он ~ пьян," иди ~ крик. Две чашки.
③То же, что и «рот».
Q ~ Дао ~ приказ ~ остановить палку ~ 叱 ~ 恫 ~ ху ~ гнев ~
Ху Яо И Лю Цзы ~ чай ~ есть в нетрезвом виде ~
напиток
hè / hẽ
Пой и пей
напиток
hē, hè, yè
I hē
1) пить; есть (жидкую пищу)
喝一口茶 сделать глоток чая
喝干一杯水 осушить стакан воды
喝汤 есть суп
喝呛 поперхнуться (при питье)
喝西北风 обр. голодать
2) выпивать, пить (спиртное)
爱喝 любить выпить
喝醉 напиться
喝闷酒 запивать горе
II hè
1) кричать, орать, голосить, вопить, зазывать
大声吆喝 кричать во весь голос, громко зазывать
2) прикрикнуть, гаркнуть, рявкнуть (чтобы испугать, отругать); (гневный) окрик, (злобный) рык
喝止 громко потребовать остановиться
棒喝 удар палкой и окрик
3) громко звучать, греметь, шуметь (о явлениях природы, животных)
蜩蟧喝秋 кузнечики громким стрекотом встречают осень
雷霆大喝 мощно прогремел раскат грома
4) ого! ух ты! ба! (восклицание удивления)
喝！来了这么多人 ого, как много народу пришло!
III yè
устар. хриплый, глухой, сиплый (о голосе)
Radicals: 口, 日, 勹, 匕  (mouth, sun, prison, spoon)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you put your spoon in the sun while you're in prison, a mouth will appear to scold you. You can never see who the mouth belongs to, but considering you're in prison it's probably a guard. Either way, that person doesn't like what you're doing and they keep scolding you when you put your spoon out into the sun.
Imagine trying to reflect some precious sunlight into your prison room with a spoon. Now imagine a mouth appearing in the way of the sunlight and it scolds you.
Reading Mnemonic
One day you finally get fed up. You need to know who the mouth of the person who's scolding you is. You stick your spoon out into the sun and the mouth appears, scolding you right on time. You reach out and grab them. But in your hand is a pile of cats (かつ).
WHAT KIND OF WORLD IS THIS THAT YOU'RE IN A PRISON WHERE CATS SCOLD YOU?!
